PLOTS.Definition: secret plans made by a group of people

BRIEFCASES.Definition: flat, rectangular bags used for carrying papers or documents

BUNKERS.Definition: strong underground rooms built to protect people from bombs

OAK.Definition: a type of strong, heavy wood from an oak tree

LAIR.Definition: a secret or hidden place where he worked or lived

FLY IN.Definition: travel to the place by aeroplane

FRONT LINE.Definition: the area where soldiers were fighting

SACRIFICES.Definition: things he gave up or lost for the cause

DRESSING DOWN.Definition: being shouted at or told off for doing something wrong

NOD.Definition: a small movement of the head to show agreement or understanding

SWEAT.Definition: the liquid that comes from the skin when you are hot

BUCKLES.Definition: metal fasteners used to close belts or straps

REINFORCED.Definition: made stronger by adding extra support

CONCRETE.Definition: a hard building material made from cement, sand, and stones

USHERED INTO.Definition: led or guided into the place

BRIEFCASE.Definition: a flat bag for carrying papers or documents

IN FULL FLOW.Definition: happening actively or at its busiest moment

LEANING.Definition: bending his body or moving it towards it

MAKING A BEELINE FOR.Definition: going straight and quickly towards it

PERIMETER.Definition: the edge or boundary of the area

INTERIM.Definition: temporary, for a short time until someone permanent was chosen

EARDRUM.Definition: the thin part inside the ear that helped him hear sounds

WANDERING.Definition: walking around without a clear purpose or direction

RUBBLE.Definition: broken pieces of stone or brick

SIGNED OFF.Definition: officially approved or agreed to it

ROGUE.Definition: acting alone and not following the rules

NAMELY.Definition: that is to say; to be specific

OVERT.Definition: open and easy to see, not secret

COUP.Definition: a sudden and illegal change of government

SNIPERS.Definition: people who shot from a hidden place

OVERTHROW.Definition: remove him from power by force

ARISTOCRATS.Definition: people from rich or noble families

HOMOGENOUS.Definition: all of the same kind or type

LANDINGS.Definition: times when soldiers arrived by sea or air to attack

MOTLEY CREW.Definition: a group of people who were very different from each other

RESERVE ARMY.Definition: extra soldiers who were kept back until needed

NEUTRALISED.Definition: made harmless or stopped from acting

PLOTTERS.Definition: people who had secretly planned it

ARRESTING.Definition: catching and taking them into custody

CONTINGENCY.Definition: a plan for an unexpected situation

DETAIN.Definition: keep him under control or stop him from leaving

CONSPIRATORS.Definition: people who had secretly planned the operation

DISARRAY.Definition: a state of confusion and disorder

CONSPIRATOR.Definition: a person who had joined the secret plan

CHAOS.Definition: complete confusion and lack of order

COURTYARD.Definition: an open space surrounded by walls or buildings

DAMN.Definition: a mild swear word used to show anger or surprise

SHOW TRIALS.Definition: unfair public trials used to shame people before punishing them

HUMILIATED.Definition: made to feel very ashamed or foolish

VENUE.Definition: a place where the event happened

HAUNTING.Definition: sad and staying in people's thoughts for a long time
